data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: An unhealthy lifestyle is an important precursor of old age disease and disability. Lifestyle risk factors such as obesity, smoking, a lack of exercise, or alcohol abuse, are largely preventable and have costly consequences, especially later in life. Smoking is a habit that can be harmful to seniors because it increases the risk of developing an assortment of health issues, including heart disease, lung-related ailments, breathing problems, and stroke. Drinking too much alcohol is also not good for older adults because of an increased risk of worsening symptoms related to osteoporosis, diabetes, or high blood pressure. The way the body processes food changes with age, which is just one of the reasons. It's not good for seniors to overdo it with high-calorie foods, processed carbohydrates, sugary snacks, and fried foods. Eating habits like this can contribute to obesity, diabetes, heart problems, and stroke.
